Reviews.Title: Bought four of these for Christmas 2013
Reviews.Author: Kristy Hodge
Reviews.Content: We bought four of these from Target for our kids for Christmas so we have had them for 2 weeks. Kids ages are 15, 12, 10, and 7. I myself own an iPod Touch 4.What I like about the Kurio Touch 4s are the parental controls. I can limit the amount of time each day (eg 60 min). I can also limit the hours (eg 3pm-8pm). When it gets close to their time limit, they get a warning. When their time is up, they are locked out. However, they can still listen to music even if their time is up (love this!). Also, if I want to override their time for a snow day, I can easily do that and they can have more play time.We don't buy apps from the Kurio App Store. We only get free apps from the Amazon App Store. I have restricted my 7 and 10 year olds so that only I can download apps for them by logging into the parental account. The 15 and 12 year olds can download their own.My daughter bought a micro SD card and loaded music on it using our home PC. She put the SD card in the Kurio Touch and has listened to many hours of music with no trouble.There are a few quirks with the Kurio Touch 4s, (restricted from searching for harmless words when using the Genius Filtering System internet profile) but overall, we couldn't be more pleased. I like my iPod Touch, but for the price and added bonus of good parental controls, the Kurio Touch 4s is a quality product and I highly recommend it.I will try to remember to come back and update at 3 months. :)UPDATE: 01/18/2014 - Today the kids got an update on their Kurio Touch 4S.  Google Play has been added!  They now have access to Gmail, Play, Maps, etc.  Good news for all of you that were discouraged by the limitation of apps!UPDATE: 03/31/2014 - All 4 Kurio Touch 4S devices are still going strong! It seems that the kids get all of their apps from Google Play instead of Amazon App Store since Google Play was made available. The boys play Clash of Clans daily. Every once in a while a device will freeze and we have to do a reset by holding the volume up button and the power button until it powers off. That seems to resolve any issues.Two complaints: #1 - The charging port on the device and the charging cord have to be connected "just so" in order to charge the device. Sometimes they don't get connected just right and the device won't charge. #2 - My daughter can't get the free Instagram app. The Instafire app is available, which is an instagram client designed for the KindleFire. The only downside? Cost is $2.99 through Amazon App Store. We just can't bring ourselves to spend any money. :)Overall, we are still very pleased with these devices and they are well worth the price we paid in December 2013 ($99 each).  They are primarily used in our house to play games, access Facebook and listen to music.  There are many eReader apps available, so you could use this device to read as well.  We also own Kindles and use those for reading.  There isn't any web browsing done on our devices.  We restrict that to computers.  Great device at a reasonable price for all ages.UPDATE 05/30/2014: My 15 year old daughter dropped her Kurio, which DID NOT have the rubber case on it.  She dropped it on concrete and the screen cracked very badly, rendering the device useless.  This is not a flaw in the product.  The boys keep their rubber cases on and have dropped the Kurio 4s countless times.  Lesson:  Keep the rubber case on these!My 7 year old son's Kurio 4s can no longer be charged.  :(  One of the prongs on the charging port inside the Kurio got bent/damaged and it will no longer connect completely to the cord.  This IS a flaw in the product, in my opinion.  My iPod Touch 4 has been charged countless times in 2 years with no problems in the charging port.  The Kurio 4s charging port is definitely inferior to Apple's product.Out of 4 devices purchased for Christmas 2013, 2 are still working (the ones that belong to my 12 year old and 10 year old boys) great after 6 months.  The good news?  The Kurio 4s is about $61 on Amazon if we want to replace them.

Reviews.Title: Kurio - great tablet that has encouraged our son to read more!
Reviews.Author: BC_TX
Reviews.Content: The Kurio was a gift from my parents to our 10 year old son - who thinks they are the coolest people in the planet! He absolutely loves it - and so do we. From our point of view, we love the fact that we can control what content he sees, when he sees it and for how long (that is a GREAT feature!). The initial set up was pretty straight forward (once connected to WiFi - things just `flow'), it took about 10 minutes for my husband (he is an engineer) to get the tablet up and running for him. We did go back at it later and tweak some of the configuration to make sure we had all our bases covered in terms of what he has access to. Again - this secondary set up was pretty straight forward. Once we gave him to him - it took him a little while to figure out the controls/hand gestures - and well - he has been loving it since. The preloaded apps/games have kept him entertained from the beginning, and then we looked for new ones (we wanted a few educational games on there). He has enjoyed those as well, and now he is able to search and download what he wants (within the limits we stipulated). We purchased an external memory card - and have uploaded a couple of his favorite movies and songs. He has taken to photograph the world around him and show us what things look like from his perspective (which is fun).  Something that caught us by surprise (and we are very thankful for) is that he loves reading books in his tablet. This is an unexpected bonus, and we will continue to encourage him to read more. We have looked at the non-child interface (we followed the instructions to activate the full Android interface - and we can see that it is useful for adults too. Basically it seems to operate in the same way as a normal Android tablet. That is a great option too!) The tablet itself seems to be well constructed, and we have spoken to him about taking care of it (don't drop it, clean your hands before use, etc.) so that it lasts long. We were a little bit disappointed that we could not find the Google Play store on it, but this was easily remedied by installing the Amazon app store instead (Little Piano is a huge hit!). So really - this is a minor point. Our son loves his Kurio and we are very happy with the level of control that we have over what content he can access. We cannot really ask for more!

Reviews.Title: disappointing
Reviews.Author: edequimm
Reviews.Content: We looked long and hard at tablets that we could use as a family - narrowing it down to the Kindle Fire and Kurio 7, both $199. Both have pros and cons for what we wanted - an educational tool for our young children, something to keep them entertained on trips as well as some functionality for us. We finally chose the Kurio 7 - the deciding factors being it has a camera and 4.0 OS. However, neither of these features make up for the fact that it does not give access to the full android market which has a much larger selection of apps, especially free apps. Kurio have their own market but it has very limited offerings (particularly in free apps for kids - when searching it said no free educational apps for kids and no free ebooks for young children!) Why would I pay for apps via Kurio market when I know I can get similar/better ones for free and a much greater range of paid ones elsewhere? I understand this is a tablet for kids and there are restrictions on the content they should have access to. But why not allow full access to android market in the parental section? Not having access to the apps I want drastically limits the functionality of this tablet for what we want. This may not be an issue for others buyers of this product but for us it is a deal-breaker and we will be returning this for the Kindle Fire.Since writing the review above a couple of days ago, I have had a chance to play with the Kurio tablet more. The camera/video recorder should not be a deciding factor in buying this tablet (which is was for us) as the quality is very poor (but in fairness it probably has similar megapixels to other cameras on tablets.) Also, some of the 'kid friendly' apps/games available on the curated Kurio market are not what I'd call (young) kid friendly (for example, a game where you stop zombies from eating farm animals and another game with explicit graphics on having your choice of saw 'cut' your fingers.) In addition, some inappropriate ads pop up "get a free gun", "3 babes want to connect with you" on some of the free games we downloaded which was surprising as the content is curated to be family appropriate and is the reason Kurio does not give access to the full android market. Perhaps these pop-up ads are outside of Kurio's control or maybe slipped under their radar? Again, these points may not be an issue for all parents, especially those with older children (ours are 4-5 yrs), but are further reasons why this is not the right tablet for us. Back to the store it goes.....

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: drD
Reviews.Content: This is a great product!  Very easy to set up.  Be sure to download the latest firm and software, that way Netflix can run.  The 7s is a very user friendly tablet.  Highly recommended!  It has dozens of pre-installed apps that are free, and if you can't find something on it already then it is easy to download whatever you want from the Amazon app store or 1Mobile Network.

Reviews.Title: Kids and I love it!!
Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: Both kids (4 years and 3 years) LOVE it! They can play games, Skype with their cousins and don't ask for my phone anymore. Love the parental controls for safety and length of time they can play for.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Karen Bennie
Reviews.Content: Got this for my 4 year old grand daughter and am amazed at the quality and different things u can do on this!  It's like a real smart phone, but its not a phone..she loves it and plays with it for hours!  Great Item, great price!

Reviews.Title: Bought 2 of them and love it
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey Swanson "swanson review"
Reviews.Content: They are excellent for our two daughters 4 and 9.  Perfect games, downloaded music and they are very happy.  I did my research and these are excellent!

Reviews.Title: Both Grandson's love it Kurio Kids Tablet with Android 4.0
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kurio Kids Tablet as a Christmas Present for my 3year old grandson and his 7 year brother likes it also.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Norene Fry
Reviews.Content: Just what my grandson needed.  Has games and book to fit his age.  It was very easy for him to learn to operate.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Michael Steven Manning
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 5 year old who is autistic. He is into Computers, & eletronics& he loves this, & never puts it down.

Reviews.Title: Kurio Kids Tablet...Not just for the Kids.
Reviews.Author: rcrmm380
Reviews.Content: So far, so good. I read other reviews which had mixed feelings so we purchased the 3 year replacementcontracts.So far we are impressed with the ease of use, programming and construction. As with everything else it shouldbe used responsibly and cared for. I read someones review that said it was a toy, which they are not. They arechildren s computers. Although we have had limited experience they have been greatly enjoyed with no problems coming up as of yet. I want one for myself. Some of the games are challenging even for adults.

Reviews.Title: KURIO KIDS TABLET
Reviews.Author: MARY TOZER
Reviews.Content: IT WAS A PRESENT FOR MY 8 YR OLD GRANDDAUGHTER AND SHE ABSOLUTELY LOVES ITSHE HAS HAD NO PROBLEMS USING IT

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: ping
Reviews.Content: the tablet is awesome my kids have been playing it for 5 years and it is still working totally reccomend

Reviews.Title: Great for learning
Reviews.Author: Juanita Green
Reviews.Content: My grandkids love it and teach me things with it all the time. It keeps their little minds busy being 5 and 6 year olds

Reviews.Title: Big appreciation from my daughter:
Reviews.Author: David Idowu
Reviews.Content: This is a gift for my younger daughter's birthday. Since she had it, she had thanked me a thoudand times and I can see the appreciation and enthusiasm written all over her face. She loved it!

Reviews.Title: Mr.
Reviews.Author: luis quitumba
Reviews.Content: All i was waiting for my kid, and I suggest to everyone that's looking for something similar to stop the search cos Kurio 7 is the best choice

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: The Kurio 7 Tablet is by far one of the most amazing tablets I have had the honor of purchasing for my kids! They are able to play on it for as long as I allow them with the wonderful time management feature and the parents controls allow me to dictate what and what they cannot see! =] Not to mention the 100s, yes you read correctly HUNDREDS of free games allow me to save money on all of the games that can entertain my kids. This product is very cost-effect. I am thoroughly happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: I'm stealing this from my kid...
Reviews.Author: April Williams "Best Guess"
Reviews.Content: What a great little tablet!  My daughter got both this and the LeapPad 2 for Christmas.  I must confess playing with this a little more than she has (perhaps she'd play more if I let her).  ;)Set-up and user profile management is a breeze.  In no time, I'd logged into the Kurio store and downloaded a whole batch of free games...all FREE.  Contrast that to the very limited apps pre-loaded on that LeapPad 2, coupled with the additional $15 I paid to add five more games.  The prices on those LeapPad apps are pretty outrageous when I can get that and better on Kurio for free.The Kurio is wireless ready and is rechargeable (just plug it up at night like a giant cell phone).Had I had it to do all over, I'd have bought the Kurio and left the LeapPad 2 at the store (then again, what would my daughter play with when I have her Kurio).

Reviews.Title: PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS DEVICE!
Reviews.Author: maegan l lufkin
Reviews.Content: I would give this product negative stars if possible.  We originally purchased on  11/12 as a Christmas gift for my son at Toys r us.  I read both negative and positive reviews about it.  And they seemed similar to all the other kids tablet on the market.  We decided on this tablet because it could get the amazon app store.  All the other tablets had device specific stores only.  Soon we will be on our 4th device.  1st was dead right out of the sealed box, second one died 2/3 wouldn't take a charge.  Kurio sent replacement received on 2/14.  Device was glitchy after only 24 hours then all the amazon apps had problems.  I followed the previous advise from techs about correcting the amazon app store, but end up having to uninstall amazon app store.  I could not get it to reload.  Called tt amazon tech support no luck.  Contacted Kurio and they can not resolve issue either, and I am still having to fight to get the device replaced under warranty.  Bottom line look at kindle fire almost the same price.  with proven amazon product and support.

Reviews.Title: disappointment
Reviews.Author: mitch
Reviews.Content: i am gutted bought 2 of these 1 for each of my children, did loads of research, looked at user manual before buying, customer reviews which at the time were good, looked at the apps that could be downloaded from amazon and number 1 market seemed a good buy.i have taken 2 of my daughters back and exchanged them and finally finding out the shop had sent the whole batch back to kurio as they were faulty. both kurios are that slow its painful, the apps don't always load if at all the meegenius never works even after several times in contacting customer support and following their instructions, the internet protection settings you have to go through about 4 times for them to save, it loses wi fi connection all the time, i could carry on but i think you get the jist

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: LaShanda Jordan
Reviews.Content: It's a nice tablet, but I bought it for my 7 year old son and he hates it. He cannot download the games on it that he wants. So it has only been used twice since it came for Christmas. I guess I should have read up on the product a little more.

Reviews.Title: I like this tablet alot
Reviews.Author: Lillian Elliott
Reviews.Content: Because my daughter really enjoys it, she can't get on the internet without my code, there's a lot of games to enhance her math and reading skills, and it's just the right size for her.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: sandria berry
Reviews.Content: This product was on time in good packaging. I was happy to see that the case that came with it was a good sturdy case. I love the parental account so that I am able to monitor what my  daughter can view on the web and able to choose age appropriate apps! I love that it cam preinstalled with apps already to go. I also like the fact that more then one profile can be added. The camera is not the best but good enough for my girls

Reviews.Title: powerful kid's tablet
Reviews.Author: Misius P "Misius"
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for the money.  Just as fast as many of the 200 dollar tablets that are out there. The kids mode is very good and granular. I can choose which applications are visible to each of up to 8 profiles. The parent mode is just plain unrestricted Android access.  And with the recent update to allow Google play makes it even better.

Reviews.Title: I like the Kurio 10s Tablet
Reviews.Author: Charles Lowe
Reviews.Content: This was the first Tablet that I have ever purchased.  It was purchased for my daughter for Christmas 2013.  Initially I was going to buy the 7s, but once I saw the 10 inch it was a done deal.  I have since bought an IPad Air for my wife as well.  The IPad Air my have a better cameras etc, but I haven't found anything the IPad Air does that the Kurio 10s can't.ProsGreat parental controlEasy to setup your child's accountKurio made good on their promise that they would support Google Play and they didSupports Google PlayCan connect up to HDTV via HDMI mini cable, sold seperatelyDecent resolution for AppsAppears to be fairly sturdy, my daughter has dropped it on several occasionsDecent price for a 10 inch screenCons:Camera is not all that great, but I knew what I was getting before I bought itBattery life doesn't compare to my IPad AirCharging port needs to be handled with caution, I have already had to exchange due to the charging port not working.  As long as an adult is plugging or removing the charging cable it should be okDoesn't support bluetoothOverall, I would recommend this tablet.  Everyone in my family has used it and we all enjoy it with no issues.  I would highly recommend getting a screen protector.  They can be a little tricky to line up and get perfect placement.  I bought a package of three, the first one I had to peel off and try again.This tablet supports Google Play, which really opens up the game selection.  Google is a recent upgrade available for this tablet.  I have not had any issue with any Apps, I installed Sykpe and my daughter loves it.  It works perfectly even with a low resolution camera.I paid $149 for this tablet at Toy R Us.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Lisa Thomas
Reviews.Content: Great gift for children, love the time limits and parental control. Charges easy and quick. My son plays with it for hours which is good because I loaded it with educational games.

Reviews.Title: Kurio Touch 4S
Reviews.Author: Loyd
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with the Kurio.  I looked around town at several of the tech stores and toy stores and couldn't find a device that does what I was looking for.  My Grandson was extremely pleased because it was loaded with his favorite game - Angry birds.  He's 3 and can operate the Kurio extremely well.

Reviews.Title: Good for price
Reviews.Author: Teresa Salmon
Reviews.Content: We actually bought it for our 2 yr old granddaughter. She has already cracked the screen even though it has a pink otter box rye case on it. We got it because she is constantly screaming to play w our cell phones which results in her calling people. Deleting things ,taking pictures and last but not least. Dropping and throwing our expensive cell phones. So this is her phone. She was not fooled by toy cell phones. We bought 5 or 6. This does fool her! She loves it. Plays little games on it. Loves the talking cats and bursting bubbles games. We are sending it back for replacement. But it was great till she cracked it! Was not screaming for our phones anymore! Hopefully can get another.

Reviews.Title: kurio7 tablet with 8gb memory 7
Reviews.Author: cheryl bernstine
Reviews.Content: bought it for my 6 year old grandson he loves it and easy for him to use i would recommend it

Reviews.Title: kurio kids tablet
Reviews.Author: connie neaves
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this product for family ..... kid control #1 & totally problem free device.  Best hands down. You will love this product.

Reviews.Title: Family Gift
Reviews.Author: history seeker
Reviews.Content: This has helped to assist with my daughter and keeping the kids on track with the options of profiles per family member more than the nook and the need for the children to complete reading before games.  this is one of the best out there for anyone needing parental control on internet access and protecting children from going to unapproved sites.

Reviews.Title: Best Christmas present!
Reviews.Author: Crystal Ann Hagen
Reviews.Content: It was in great shape just like the add said. Works wonderful my grandson is happy he said its his favorite gift.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Wanda Ritter
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a wonderful Christmas gift for my grandson. I like the parental guide to set time for reading and playing games!

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: krystle
Reviews.Content: The kids really enjoy it. I like the parental control, it alows us to set how long they can play may get one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Dreamy
Reviews.Author: C. Sherene
Reviews.Content: It came in a timely manner and it is what my son wanted. He plays with it all the time. He is 11 years old.

Reviews.Title: Bought for my granddaughter
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Weaver
Reviews.Content: I purchased the tablet for my granddaughter for her holiday gift.  She carries it with her all the time and it is absolutely her favorite gift. She is a beautiful four (4) years old angel.  She loves it so much that her mother told me she sleeps with the tablet and her favorite blanket. Very pleased with the ability to use filters - even her mother is happy helping her use it, however my angel won't let anyone else hold the tablet for very long.  She politely says that her Grannie gave that to her and to give it back. I'm so happy I could give her a first 'computer'. She calls it her computer so that's fine by me.

Reviews.Title: not too bad
Reviews.Author: cassidy
Reviews.Content: it was alright but some games you just couldn't download, my son never used it so i sent it back ;(

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: mrsdoodle
Reviews.Content: this was a my 6 years old grandson's Christmas present.  easy to set up.  parents very pleased with this product.

Reviews.Title: Since they added Google Play I think this is the best "kid" Android tablet!
Reviews.Author: Lewis
Reviews.Content: When we first got this tablet for our little guy I wasn't sure if it was going to be a good buy because there was no Google Play access.. well today I got an update notification.. and it upgraded the OS and added Google Play!This tablet is as fast as my iPad mini and has all the stuff that we need to keep our little one from accessing content that we wouldn't want him to see.We are very happy about this purchase.. without the Play Store I would have given it 3 stars.. with it I give it 5!!

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift satisfaction
Reviews.Author: patricia anthony
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my granddaughter per her request.  I am more than happy with the product.  Gave it to her ChristmasEve and she loves it.

Reviews.Title: not as kid friendly as I had hoped
Reviews.Author: Lori "cats12188"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this thinking it would be sturdier than other tablets. I also loved the idea of the parental controls. Well after a week, the screen was malfunctioning. Not really sure what happened but my son denies that it was dropped, stepped on etc. He is 7 so who knows. I am in the process of discussing how to get a replacement w/ Kurio. Parents beware. It is still a tablet that needs to be carefully handled. Don't be fooled by the bumper.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE!
Reviews.Author: Francesca
Reviews.Content: Poor tech support.  Only via live-chat.  I'm rather computer savvy and couldn't understand how to install system updates.  Finally, I was told to return the unit for replacement at my shipping expense.  The unit didn't even make the one year warrantee.  Very small battery life.  slow processor... etc.  ZERO STARS.

Reviews.Title: It is crapy
Reviews.Author: DONETTE CHAMBERS
Reviews.Content: I like the kids friendly features,the protective bumper. Every month a different problem quite often it will not go on the Internet,recently the keyboard is not coming up. It is unfair to the customer to pay each time to send it to the manufacture,at the end of the manufacture's warranty courier service will add up to the cost of another Kurio. Do not purchase this product before you read the reviews and try to look deeper into the negative ones they are the true reviews that will help you make the right decision.

Reviews.Title: Horrid customer service!  Skip it!
Reviews.Author: Mama "Mama"
Reviews.Content: My daughter (10) saved for this for a LONG time.  It arrived yesterday and would not connect to wifi at all.  I called customer service only to be rudely told I must be doing something wrong!  The rep told me I had to send an email for help they have no tech support!  I explained I just wanted to return it at this point since I had an issue right out of the box and they were unable to help.  She was rude and I asked for a supervisor who refused to take the item back until I had 6 emails from them attempting to fix the issue and informed me I would have to pay to ship back and would not get a refund on tax or shipping and could take up to 12 weeks to get a refund and then she HUNG UP ON ME!  At a loss I emailed for help and the first email I got after explainingy problem started out " obviously you are incorrectly..." I emailed back and got the same form letter back!  I did get it connected thanks to MY Internet provider and its not all its made out to be very confusing for a child but am keeping since I would only get about half my money back after 3 months!  Pass on this item get a kindle fire!

Reviews.Title: Very poor
Reviews.Author: Teresa Link "Miss Shopper"
Reviews.Content: WE bought this tablet and were so excited to get it and try it out. I bought it in November and tried to get it set up before Christmas so ti would be ready to go. No Google Play store was a huge drawback for us. But there is suppose to be the Kurio Store to get new apps from and Amazon App Store. Neither of them work. Upon contacting Kurio, they say the Third Party (SlideMe) is the app provider and they are having problems. They had NO answer as to why the amazon app store never works either. I didn't find all this out til Christmas day when nothing would work as it was suppose to. I cannot return it to Amazon since it wasn't DEAD ON ARRIVAL so I am left with my only recourse being dealing with Kurio. I am not a happy camper. I wish I had just gotten a kindle fire. $199 buck down the tubes if Kurio won't back their product.

Reviews.Title: Stay Away!!! Buy a different kids gaming system!
Reviews.Author: Dawn Jackson
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these, one for each of my boys (age 2 and 5). I have to say I am less than impressed with them! Although they have stood up to my 2 year olds throwing them around (very sturdy and no cracked screens yet, I really wished we had picked another system for our boys. So far they've lasted 4 months and still going although I'm tempted to throw them out the window at times. Save your $150 and buy something else.The good:*Sturdy and come with a rubber case to protect them from being thrown around.* A good selection of games to download for free. I chose these over a traditional gaming + cartridge system because the games get so expensive. Lots of free apps/games here to download (also one's you can buy too) My kids love the free angry birds apps!The bad:*BATTERY LIFE is tiny. I think we've rarely gone more than an hour or 90 minutes without the device going dead. Really inconvenient when you're about to take them on a road trip into town and you forgot to charge the battery for one of the. My boys argue over the one that still has battery left in it....that's why we bought 2 in the first place! Grrr!*Takes forever to load to the home screen. It takes at least a full 2 minutes before it's in play mode on the home screen and to a 2 year old that is an eternity!*also is not very user friendly to set up. It kept asking me to register the device and complete the setup. This included inputting my home wi-fi password and setting parental controls, email address, etc. Until I competed the setup my kids had to keep handing them back to me to get them to the home screen so they could play the games. Very annoying.*Once I did get the devices set up, then they automatically go to the "kids friendly" screen while my kids started out using the alternate (non-registered) screen and they don't like the kid screen. In order to get it set up on the alternate screen I have to enter the password from the parental controls EVERY TIME my kids want to play with them. Again, very annoying!!!****The most annoying feature of all is when I attempt to enter the password for the parental controls, the device somehow enters phantom characters while I'm trying to enter the password. Totally messes up the password entry and I have to delete and start over. I've had to do this many times and this is where I wanted to throw the device out the window. I try to type something like "2345" and it types "2_djfkla;j" sometimes there's 3 characters for every 1 I actually type into the on screen keyboard.And done. Never again! I should have read Amazon reviews before I chose a device for my kids. These were an impulse buy with much regret! This is what I get for not having a smart phone and being able to check online reviews on the spot!

Reviews.Title: Kurio
Reviews.Author: Teacher55
Reviews.Content: I thought the Kurio would be the right tablet for my kids.  Although it was a bit frustrating to set up, my kids do seem thoroughly entertained by it.  They love to play the built-in apps, but I wish they had full access to android market. Most of the games are typical apps. like Angry Birds etc., but there are some cute educational apps like Nussbaum teaching apps which I use in my actual classroom sometimes. My kids liked the boxing app where they could practice adding and subtracting numbers, although the touch-screen can be less than responsive.  Wish there was a greater selection of these learning apps.

Reviews.Title: SUCKS BIG TIME AND KURIO SUPPORT IS HORRIBLE!!!
Reviews.Author: Dr.Remulac
Reviews.Content: my daughter got thtis for her birthday literally used it maybeeeeee 20 times within 3 months , it will not charge, it will not power on, ive tried different outlets and still nothing . I have emailed kurio support at least 5 times  . the first time the rep tell me stick a paperclip in the hole and I did that and nothing the second time I replied that ive tried that and im still waiting for a response  the third time I resubmitted my plea and the 4th and 5th im just begging to hear anything from that company at all.  do not buy and if you received this as a gift just tell the person if you can kindly exchange it for different tablet

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth21t
Reviews.Content: My mom bought this for my son and TWICE we have had to send our device back due to the charger not working BOTH times.

Reviews.Title: HORIBLE!
Reviews.Author: Betsy Tennant
Reviews.Content: My daughter got one for Christmas (she is 10) its HORIBLE! For littler kids it would be fun. She HATED it, we returned it to toysrus.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy Kurio products
Reviews.Author: Kellerina
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend purchasing a Kurio product. My "new" tablet came used, their customer service is practically non existent, no phone number, no one picks up the "live chat" and it took over 9 days to respond to my email for help. I had already returned the device at that point. How could I make my son wait to play with a defective Christmas present until someone decided to finally answer an email?  In addition, I had put $ in the "piggy bank" for the Kurio store from my credit card and Kurio will not refund me my $.  The $ was never used to buy any apps or anything. They are a horrible company all around. I would give it zero stars if I had the option.

Reviews.Title: Forced to give 1 star
Reviews.Author: Pamela
Reviews.Content: If this rating system would allow for zero or negative stars it would certainly be more accurate.  I purchased for Christmas for my 8 yr old son to use for homework, games, etc.  I gave it to him a week early because I was excited. I input ALL of our personal information only to have the system stop working on Christmas Eve; less than a week after he received it.  The bubbly screen stayed on and finally went off by itself.  We fully charged it for two days only to have the KD Interactive logo stay on for more than 8 hours; even after five attempts to hit the reset button.  The screen went blank for a second and came back on.  FINALLY went off but won't come on again.  Read the manual that directed me online where I sat for over 5 mins chatting with myself because the system kept timing me out and resetting.  No one ever acknowledged my presence.  I finally gave up and located a number for Kurio 4S model.  Called and the loop kept telling me to hold on before it finally directed me to "leave a message."  They had better be glad I don't curse but I left a scathing voicemail that they are probably just laughing at because they don't care.  Who sells a product without providing a phone number for customer support.  Better yet, who BUYS a product without fully researching this?  I honestly didn't think I would need customer support and surely not within one week of buying the product.  Oh, and the number I found was only available M-F until 3pm PST; how convenient for those of us who are in different time zones and have jobs.  They ask you in the pamphlet to not return the unit to the store but to reach out to them.  What a joke.  PLEASE do yourself a favor and avoid the headache; buy a different, more reliable product and save yourself the headache.  I work hard for my money and I WILL be returning device to the store as soon as possible because I refuse to be stuck with such a product that didn't last beyond one week of use and clearly lacks proper customer support.  Again, was very excited to buy this and my son was more excited than I was to receive it.  Congratulations to those who were lucky enough to get a working device and good luck to those who are brave enough to venture down the path of disappointment!

Reviews.Title: $150 to Play Angry Birds
Reviews.Author: P. Kudsieh
Reviews.Content: We got this as a present for our son and we couldn't be more disappointed. One of their big selling features is the parental control software which enables parents to limit what the child can do online - outside of the games that come included with the tablet.Sure they work but really aren't needed. That's cause the hardware does this job for you. It makes surfing the net next to impossible and an incredibly frustrating experience. I kid you not it took 25 minutes to check an email with gmail. It was the same with almost any other site on the net.Playing the games worked fine but after awhile our son wanted new games and so we tried to download the app that is needed to download more games (whether free or paid) and again, after 25 minutes couldn't get it done. There's no real instructions on how to do that and none to poor customer support. So we looked online for fixes that people post on youtube and other sites and tried them to no avail. They required some advanced technical knowledge too.So here we sit with a tablet that plays Angry Birds and few other uninteresting games ... out $150 and our son has moved on. I wouldn't feel right selling it so on top of the hassle we've incurred we'll need to make a trip to a retail store that recycles electronics, where, I'll bet, they have a separate bin just for these.

Reviews.Title: It fine for 5 and 4 year olds
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: Perfect for 5 and 4 year old kids... OK so first i read thru many reviews and saw some real negative reviews.. I think tablet is just fine. Clearly wanted to buy the kIndle fire but I'm buying two of them. I also liked the Sony tablet but that one was 199.00 ... It had very good reviews.Next this tablet works just fine the games are perfect for my kids. The ebooks are great. I am pretty good with computers so I have no issues clearing and setting up this thing.  For all the negative reviews I think some are expecting this tablet to be like a Ipad or Kindle it's NOT, it's a kid tablet I would not get it for the "family" I have a ipad and clearly the ipad is much faster. But for now this tablet is fine, no issues at all.Any child older then 7 I would go with something more advanced like the Kindle or even the Sony version. Just my opinion

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!!!
Reviews.Author: Katrina Mayberry
Reviews.Content: It is a piece of junk. I bought my daughter one for her birthday.  The first couple of weeks it worked fine and she loved it.  After that it started giving her trouble.  The battery dies at 20%, it shuts off when it wants to, it freezes, you can't do netflix, the camera on the back sucks, ... I could go on forever.  It's not even a year old and we are having all these problems.  I personally do not recommend this for any one.

Reviews.Title: I would give five stars... but
Reviews.Author: Quintrem
Reviews.Content: There are ways to get the Google play on there. I've done that. It is seemingly easy to root. The ONLY reason I give it a three star rating is it needs the screen calibrated very badly. Everything else about it is great. I recommend getting your child the kurio 4s. My two year old loves it. I liked it so much I bought one for myself. I am in search of a solution.

Reviews.Title: kurio
Reviews.Author: deborah
Reviews.Content: My grandkids love it 10 in our eyes.  I would recommend this to parents looking for a tablet for their kids.

Reviews.Title: the best
Reviews.Author: nijjy
Reviews.Content: My son is 8 and he loves his kurio tab alot. Finally I found something for him to use that is inexpensive easy to use and  is protected. It has games, app store it's good for kids 6yrs and above. I am happy that i bought it, my son is happy and I would 100% recommend it.

Reviews.Title: BROKE MULTIPLE TIMES!!!
Reviews.Author: matt
Reviews.Content: Honestly I would not recommend this to anybody ever! we had it for barely over a month and it wouldn't even turn on. then we contacted kurio and they told us how to troubleshoot and it broke like 2 more times since then and sometimes it wont even hold a charge and it does then the battery dies really fast! theres no way i would even pay $50 for it. the only good thing was the apps that came with it. if  there were zero stars then that's what I would give.

Reviews.Title: Gage's kurio
Reviews.Author: Boop
Reviews.Content: He loves it and simple to use. Mom can use it too. Kid friendly and he can share with his little sister

Reviews.Title: disappointed very very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "hip to reading"
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I usually dont write review, but this is call for. I'm very unhappy with the product in price in it don't have access to google play. I brought this for my son he is 4, althought he loves it  which I can't blame, but I look look at the long picture. It said that it has kurio Android app ok cool for kids, then it give you the ability to switch from kurio to Android. I'm like wow ok then I can just download the google play store app, well I did, but guess what I won't open, now I think about the kurio system is pre install so it won't let me. For a kid its ok for a 4 year old, but I don't understand how it could be for families. The price is too much not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Hall
Reviews.Content: I brought this for my 8 year old nephew who is more computer knowledgeable then some adults.  However, for reason unknown he and I have too much trouble trying to connect to the internet.  Wish I had brought my nephew a Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Lots of fun for my Kids!
Reviews.Author: Strawberryshrt
Reviews.Content: All my kids play my Android & iPAD so I wanted to get them something of their own and this Kurio was the perfect thing. My twin girls love it. They are both age 8. This product would be good for a lot of different ages. if your child can work a iphone or ipad they will be able to use this. The price for the product is also very reasonable. We have not had any issues with delays or in playing a game. The camera is both front and back facing with video. There are plenty of games and apps to choose from if you do not like the ones that are preloaded on the unit. You also have the option of using the parental control and limited your childs play times and also limited sites they can view online. I love it and would recommend buying this if you are looking for a great electronic product for your child.

Reviews.Title: good machine
Reviews.Author: Keith V. Shafer
Reviews.Content: 6 yr old is using it well and enjoying it, can navigate thru it pretty easy,I highly recommend it for kids

Reviews.Title: Great Kids Tablet!
Reviews.Author: joy person
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet for kids and for parents who worry about their children using tablets that can easily access the internet, various sites and even be worked like a phone.  This is a tablet made just for kids with so many great apps and so easy to use that even my 5 year old can use this without any help.  In fact she teaches me something new almost everyday about it.  I would recommend this to anyone with a child who wants a tablet but you don't want them to have a tablet that allows them to do whatever they want online.  This is great for learning, having fun and is amazing for long road trips or long waits.

Reviews.Title: Bad and Not worth its money
Reviews.Author: Kierra Hayes
Reviews.Content: My brother got this and it broke in two weeks so we returned it and got a new one.  The new one broke after a week. They both stopped charging and they would not connect to the internet.  Overall I would not buy this product.

Reviews.Title: tablet Kurio 7S
Reviews.Author: ERNESTO ALVAREZ
Reviews.Content: I got it for my 3 year old, and I love I would recommend it to anyone with kids even no that sometimes I use it for the games and my other daughter 11 years too, the only problem that I see is the micro USB like nowadays in the phones too, it gets loose and probably one day need to be send back the tablet, like many phones I think that is a mayor problem but looks like no one is complaining about it(USB micro ports) that after many times inserting plugging and unplugging will not work and the device need to be send back. but anyway this is beside the point for the tablet.yes I would buy it again

Reviews.Title: Kurio 7s
Reviews.Author: Sdcv
Reviews.Content: It was good my nephew like it a lot graphics is ok operating system is good for what is was made forBut I didn't like that it did not come with a chargerOver all it's worth it

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: suehey
Reviews.Content: is a very good tablet to our children until I use it and I also fun to use I feel like if I were to be a girl again I really love it

Reviews.Title: was kind of scared
Reviews.Author: Anthony B.
Reviews.Content: It turned out to be small, but was packed for kids. I sent it to my 4yo grandson. Should go over excellent.

Reviews.Title: Good 1st Device
Reviews.Author: Justin M. Kolenc "J Michael K"
Reviews.Content: After growing tired of sharing out iPads with the kids, we had Santa bring two Kurio Touch 4S to our house this year. The kids LOVE them! I recommend skipping the Kurio Store and downloading the Amazon Apps store because the selection is better, and support is seamless with your existing Amazon account. Also, these are what a local repairman called "disposable pads." By this he means that if you crack the glass, or have other major problems, the cost of repairs will exceeded the cost of buying a new unit. If your kids are good with their personal possessions, this is no problem. If they are careless, you may find yourself replacing these like I did for my son after only 1 month. Again, this isn't Kurio's fault. The price point is low enough that these still make sense, just not if your kids are violent! lol

Reviews.Title: Broke
Reviews.Author: Mariah
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these items for my kids. With in the first month, one Kurio stop playing sounds from the apps. And the second one after a month in a half just is either not coming on or the screen is blank. I am very disappoint as are my children as well. I am a single parent and can not affordto replace these items until Christmas. I am furious that i can not reach anyone to help wit hrepair of thses items.

Reviews.Title: This is so cool!!
Reviews.Author: Undra
Reviews.Content: This is a really cool tablet!! There are games and lots more for children. It is so addictingly fun for kids, even adults.

Reviews.Title: The Product Arrived Defective Brand New Out of the Box
Reviews.Author: Kevin Coleman
Reviews.Content: The Product Arrived Defective Brand New Out of the Box. The unit will not charge properly using the DC or USB connection.

Reviews.Title: nope
Reviews.Author: jasmine cratic
Reviews.Content: Because the tablet doesn't really work and it closes out app and the internet browser and the volume is real low

Reviews.Title: sucks
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It cuts off all the time and the app store is not Google play the app store don't work half the time it sucks don't buy it

Reviews.Title: affordable but...
Reviews.Author: amanda johnson
Reviews.Content: extremely small and limited even for a child's tablet. My son has had the tablet for less than a week and it seems that it gets confused with phones and everything else. There is also very little that can be done on the tablet as far as educational purposes.

Reviews.Title: dont waist
Reviews.Author: Lakeima
Reviews.Content: don't waist your time or your money I brought this and it stop working in 30 minutes will not charge and will not turn on as well as making a funny noise . so pissed off . Im still waiting to hear back from the people who sent me the product o I can get my money back to buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Battery
Reviews.Author: Anjelica Zehrung
Reviews.Content: Battery does not last long. Other then that the device is great. Including for interesting the youngsters. It's good for distractions.

Reviews.Title: BROKE WITHIN FIRST WEEK
Reviews.Author: Teresa Spicer "RED41"
Reviews.Content: DROPPED ON FLOOR, SCREEN CRACKED WONT COME ON NOW. SCREEN NOT COVERED UNDER WARRANTY. IS NOT KID FRIENDLY. HAD PROTECTIVE CASE ON IT.

Reviews.Title: kurio tablets for kids
Reviews.Author: Helen Darlene Guzman
Reviews.Content: the tablets were better than i expected. i enjoy the parental control over what my children are allowed to watch.

Reviews.Title: the kurio tablet did not work
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: I had to send it back because it did not work. and I have not heard anything else about it. and the payment have not been put back in my account. whats going on

Reviews.Title: worst gift
Reviews.Author: Danyca Simon
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst gift I ever brought my son. He played with this product all of one week.I had trouble with downloading apps.I  tried reaching out customer service that is when I found out they only respond by email .the first time to respond back to me and 9 hours the second time to respond back to me in two week. I just wanted to comment on this product because I feel as though I want to go purchased this product there are better ones on the market we do not on products this was the worst so I feel it was a need to say something if I could I would return it but I couldn't find very very with this product it continues to stay on the dresser collecting dust in this point of having it for 2 months

Reviews.Title: returned
Reviews.Author: Faith Wineberg
Reviews.Content: We returned it. It would not hold a charge. It was not worth the effort. Bought a kindle in it's place.

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY IT
Reviews.Author: monica
Reviews.Content: I am NOT happy with this tablet. I dont even know where to begin. its probably ok for smaller children who will only be playing a few games. but if you want more out of it, or full use, FORGET IT!First of all, I will say that speed wise it is fine and also the battery life is not too bad considering the price. But, i hate the fact that it does not use google play store, so you can forget about finding any games you've ever gotten there. it only comes with the "kurio store" on which EVERYTHING costs $ there are NO free apps. then  they offer you to add other app stores ( not google play) but they offer them at your own risk, if anything goes wrong with your tablet from using the 3rd party stores, they will not be responsible. well, thats just crap. the other stores they offer, two of which i have never even heard of, one of them though, is amazon app. they do have free apps, but still not every available app you can get on google play. you cannot get the real Youtube app, no matter which of the 4 stores you choose. only one had the netflix app, and when i got it logged in and picked a movie, only the audio was working and not the video, so i tried another movie to make sure it wasnt just that movie, but no, still no video. contacted kurio. they will NOT help you, because netflix is a 3rd party app. so they had me called netflix. i called netflix and they were glad to try and help so they sent me an email with complicated instructions that i still havent figured out, i am SERIOUSLY considering returning the damn things ( i bought two) but i dont know what kids tablet i can get that uses google play, because im told nabi2 and kindle fire also use amazon app store. im SO disapointed because my kids and myself were looking forward to these tablets being great, and its the biggest let down ever. also, my kids' favorite game is Hayday, and it is NOT available in any of the 4 stores. what a disaster.I WOULD NOT RECCOMEND TO ANYONE TO BUY THIS TABLET!!!!!!!!!!!!and if you do, i hope you have no problems with it because kurios customer service really STINKS!Bad job Kurio, bad job :(UPDATE:After owning the tablet for about 2 weeks, a system update became available, and upon installing it, Google Play store is now available, which I am glad about. Also, after the update, Netflix began to work. Im glad Kurio did resolve these issues, as they were my main two concerns. Im still not happy with the fact I had to go through the hassle to begin with, and the fact they initially misrepresented the fact you could get netflix.However, now that the two main issues have been resolved, I would rate it 3 stars instead of one, for future buyers, assuming that when they get theirs, it will have the current update, and they wont have to go through the hassle that I did.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: Melissa R. Smith
Reviews.Content: This is not worth the extra money.  I debated between this model and a Kindle Fire.  Because of the parental controls and kid friendly marketing the Kurio was our choice for our 6 y/r.  Compared to the Kindle Fire, the battery does not last as long, it takes longer to charge, the camera quality is very poor.  Adding apps from the Amazon store was not as easy as on a Kindle. We have 3 Kindle Fires in our house and will be adding another very soon.  I have returned it through the awesome help of Amazon Customer Service and will buy him a Kindle Fire HDX.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Elsie
Reviews.Content: I bought this item for my Grandson for Christmas in October.  It worked for a week and then when you power it up it just keeps searching and does nothing.  I contacted the seller in January and they will do nothing about it.  I tried to contact Kurio the company and they do not answer e-mails or calls.  DO NOT BUY this I could have gotten it at Walmart for less.  I am calling the BBB

Reviews.Title: New name Turtle to the Snail
Reviews.Author: Ava
Reviews.Content: This is the slowest piece of junk I ever came across.  What child have the type of patient to wait at least 5 mins to turn on their tablet.  I brought this for my son 3rd birthday and it was broken in less than a month.  The apps are hard to download and it slow.  The computer allow barely any outside game at a fast rate.  The one that comes with the tablet are stupid and ridiculous, they can't keep a three year old attention.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY BUYING THIS PRODUCT.

Reviews.Title: 4 months and product stopped working.
Reviews.Author: leesette de santiago
Reviews.Content: My tablet stopped charging and no matter what plug I have tried to use it will not charge.  It will not turn on.  It does not work.  Poor product.  Waste of my money.

Reviews.Title: Granddaughter loves it
Reviews.Author: Betty Berthold
Reviews.Content: My Granddaughter loved it, they play it all the time, no complaints - It was a little hard to program

Reviews.Title: Sooo disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Max09
Reviews.Content: My son's grandmother bought him a Kurio for Christmas.  It worked on Christmas day and we charged it that night only to discover that it would no longer power up properly.  It was stuck in a "sleep mode" every time it powered up.  I emailed Kurio twice without ever hearing back from them and of course, they have no phone number listed.  I tried to start 2 live chat sessions and no one ever joined and then I finally reached someone on live chat and was told to perform two different methods for a factory reset - neither of them worked.  I would never recommend this product to anyone, not only because the Kurio itself is a poorly made product but because it is difficult to reach anyone at their company and they do not respond to tech support emails.  What a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Two of four ordered Kurio tablets would not charge! Very disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Donna Luketich
Reviews.Content: I ordered 4 of the Kurio 7 tablets for my grandchildren for Christmas presents. Prior to Christmas I charged all 4 so they would be ready to use on the big night but one of my grandson's tablets was dead and would not charge at all. The only way he could play on his was sitting by an outlet with it plugged into an outlet. Next in Jan my granddaughter's is doing the same not charging and also unable to download aps to it.  Again very disappointing. I went on Amazon and returned both (two separate time) and the process to return was very good and credit issued back promptly.  I am concerned now in the very near future the other two will have the same issues?

Reviews.Title: Don't buy!
Reviews.Author: Bri
Reviews.Content: We purchased this tablet for my 4 year old for Christmas. Within three hours, the power button had broken off!! We proceeded to power it up with a pen for a few weeks and pushing it into the side. Then the volume button fell off!!! What a joke. I then found the receipt and returned it. Piece of junk!!

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my son. Within 2 weeks of purchase it locked up and we had to do a factory reset. We have done 2 more since. Now the battery wont charge and the company says to reset it again... that would be great if I could turn it on... but with no battery life left I cant do that. I want to return it and I will never purchase Kurio products again. I wish I had checked more reviews before I made this purchase. Just to return it is going to be a task... and my son is heart broken since this was his "big" gift...*Scratch sending it back to where I purchased it from. I bought it November 20th... they wont take a return. So if I want my Kurio touch replaced I have to deal with the company. So basically I have a very expensive paper weight. Greaaaaaaat.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING PRODUCT BUT WISH THERE WAS MORE IN STORAGE MEMORY
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: I love all the parental items it has and that you have full control over everything your child does on it.  I also love that it doesn't allow the kids to purchase anything by "accident" on the apps that have 1 touch purchasing.  The only complaint is that it doesn't store many of the newer apps bc they require a bit more memory.  Otherwise, it is amazing and durable, so much so that after we bought the first one for my 9 yr old daughter, we recently purchased another one for my 3 year old son.  :)

Reviews.Title: really liked the kurio
Reviews.Author: trish
Reviews.Content: My grandaughter received the Kurio for Christmas from a family friend They were going to buy her a Meep, but thankfully they changed their minds! The Kurio comes with full versions of ALL of the games my daughter loves to play on my iPad (cut the rope, angry birds, where's my water etc.). There are also plenty of educational games and it has several ebooks that she can either listen to, sound them out herself, or have someone read to her. Best of all there are parental controls!

Reviews.Title: my daughter only use 3 months
Reviews.Author: nelson
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday gift from my daughter,the first month it worked fine, the second month, he began to have problems in the percent load, in the third month only works connected to electricity,i spend my money on something cheap in the end not worth it, I regret having bought this article, My daughter loved this tablet, but now the tablet does not work and I will not buy another, I will not recommend this brand to anyone, sorry the quality is very poor, buy it on November 17 and Jan. 24 today no longer works, I would like to give me my money but they waste my time and finally I just offered another tablet. :( Now I have to buy a ipad of $399.

Reviews.Title: Waste of my money
Reviews.Author: Tracey M. Torreyson
Reviews.Content: Both my sons have one of these tablets and I absolutely don't like them! The battery on these things can be 90% or more and the thing turns off on them while they are playing a game or reading (and it does it QUITE often) and won't turn back on unless you plug the thing in. And when it is working, it runs slow. For $150.00 a pop, I think these tablets could have been better quality. For their birthdays this year I will be replacing them with the Kindle Fire. Good thing I hadn't bought one for my daughter yet!

Reviews.Title: Kurio Kids
Reviews.Author: Trish Arnold
Reviews.Content: This was for my grandson.  He would rather use my husband's ipad.  I don't know why but I liked his but I rate it as I see them.

Reviews.Title: great for the kids
Reviews.Author: sonya Allstun
Reviews.Content: this tablet is great for the kids. They love eit but for an adult I would say find another you wont be real happy with it. But it is durable and easy to use for kids  most apps the kids like to play load fine and just found out on their facebook page you can get google play store

Reviews.Title: Junk!
Reviews.Author: Tracey Brewer
Reviews.Content: I paid 100$ for this and day one the charging cord fell apart. It no longer charges or updates the sad slot shot the card out hit me in the eye I had to go to ER! Really safe for kids! It's useless! Good luck getting any help from them I tried 3 live chats and 7 emails! I've gotten no where! If anyone knows a phone number or the real manufacturer of these rip off kings please let me know ASAP!

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: sopharin may
Reviews.Content: Been only a month. My son played it only on weekends so that's about 6 use? Turns on but the screen is blank. I'm not going thru the hassle of returning n trying to get it replaced.. Over all.. Will not be ordering ever again

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service.
Reviews.Author: Brent Malley "OpmgruV"
Reviews.Content: We ordered this for our son for Christmas.  The first day we took it out the battery would not charge, so we contacted customer service (which by the way is only on line.)  They were very quick to respond, and asked us to send back the tablet, at our expense. They replaced it with a Kurio7s because the Kurio is no longer being made.  So the upgrade was wonderful!  Got the tablet out and charged it.  Worked great until it ran completely out of battery and we could not get it to turn on.  Read the directions and it is not to be played once it gets lower than 5% battery and can not be played while plugged in.  We had to hard reset the tablet, and it was only used for a few hours.  We sent it back to Amazon and ordered a Kindle for our son!!  He loves it.  The tablet seemed to have some fun games, and could be connected to the Google play store.  Keep that in mine when you are buying this tablet.  I am glad that we went with the Kindle Fire.  I am giving the tablet a 3 star rating because the customer service was wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: need more apps
Reviews.Author: LaShondria Smith
Reviews.Content: My 9 yo wants more apps available other than that great learning device and is fun as well. Get one

Reviews.Title: kurio
Reviews.Author: tamara stubbs
Reviews.Content: The kurio is a good tool for a child but it freezes a lot when watching a movie sometimes it goes of and doesn't come on that out is a piece of crap I wouldn't recommend that any one purchase until they check the operation system on it again

Reviews.Title: Completely died after 2 weeks.
Reviews.Author: L
Reviews.Content: Got this from TRU for my daughter's birthday. She loved it -- until it completely died on her 2 weeks later and was an inconsolable wreck. She thought her pet cat (one of the apps, apparently) was dead, too. Great. Thanks, Kurio. Returned it and got the Samsung Galaxy Tab instead.

Reviews.Title: Broken Kurio
Reviews.Author: lance taylor
Reviews.Content: I purchased 7 of these kurio for my grandkids for christmas and with not very much use two of them have allready broke the screen just goes black and will not do anything .I am going to have to send them back and see if they will replace them.

Reviews.Title: Arrived broken
Reviews.Author: Patricia Clark
Reviews.Content: It arrive with crack/broken screen and unable to use.  I had to order another one because my grandchild was insistent on a Kurio Kids Tablet.

Reviews.Title: did not work
Reviews.Author: pastor
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace one that was broken. But have had problems from the beginning with it. It never fully charged and was always needing to be plugged up. When I realized there was a problem it was too late to return because I had it for 3 months. It now sits in the closet until I can find some place to recycle it. Even took it out the other day to just see if could charge but would not even begin charge up. I am very dissatisfied with this seller and except for the fact that 1 star is the lowest rating possible there would be a negative in my book. I will not purchase any product from this place.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Unfortunately....
Reviews.Content: Do not purchase this product, or anything from Kurio. I purchased 2 of the Kurio 7 tablets for my kids on September 20th 2012, within 1 month the Kurio interface no longer worked on one of them, and within 3 months the other will not charge or power on. The only way to contact the company is through email (which I have no received no reply) or through their "live chat", which you will never actually be connected to a representative. As far as the device goes, when it was working it was not a quality device, the touch screen isn't sensitive enough, you can not access Google Play, the Amazon App store runs poorly. the Kurio market is a joke, and adding new apps was painful to say the least. Save yourself some money and a headache, don't buy this.

Reviews.Title: For younger kids!
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Olsen
Reviews.Content: I think my kids, ages 7 & 9, are too old for the options offered. They only want items that we download and the wireless constantly shuts off...even when it shows a strong signal! It takes forever to download if it even allows us to do it!

Reviews.Title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
Reviews.Author: Lindiwe Mndebele
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with this gadget. I bought it for my nephew for his birthday and hardly 3 weeks later it just shut down and we cannot even charge it. For some reason Amazon omitted to include the receipt in the box so I figured it was impossible to return it. So I took it to the repairman and to my utter dismay he told me that it will cost more than the purchase price to repair it.I would be grateful if Amazon can advise what I should do now. I spent a lot of money on the tablet for it to be just thrown away without any compensation.

Reviews.Title: Nice tab for kids
Reviews.Author: Wiliam Myers
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little tablet for children --- only problem with this one is that it will not charge --- it charged at first and worked reallly well - LOVE the parental control in that of like a 'timer' so they (the kids) are not on it for too long at a time --- but after couple days it wound not re-charge when connected - will have to return it and request an exchange - but want another one just like this one -- and hope the re-charge part of it will work fine.

Reviews.Title: Waste of $200
Reviews.Author: Patrick D. Craft "Patrick Craft"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 7 year old who loves games and electronics. Comes with its own Kurio app store which is worthless and also has a few others you can install, amazon app being the only one worth using. One of the app stores had a porn app on it. This is suppose to be a family friendly tablet. The Kurio runs on a Android platform but is not approved by Google to run Google Play app store. Save your money and buy a tablet manufactured by a reputable company.

Reviews.Title: works only for a while
Reviews.Author: buttercup
Reviews.Content: this product has performance issuses.......worked for a while then you get a triangle in the center with an exclamation mark

Reviews.Title: Kurio 7
Reviews.Author: marisa morales
Reviews.Content: It never worked properly I'm actually returning it! Maybe if it worked it would've been a great Christmas present! Frustrating

Reviews.Title: Not pleased with product
Reviews.Author: Toyoa Wallace
Reviews.Content: Not pleased with product... I purchased 2 units, one didn't work straight from the box. I have emailed customer service through Kurio 3 times, no one has responded. Meanwhile I have a 4 year old that would like to use his tablet. The unit continues to shut off and has to be rebooted 10-12 times in a short time span. I am highly displeased. Also shopping was every expensive and it took longer than expected to receive. Would not recommend

Reviews.Title: Kurio Kids Tablet with Android 4.0 - 7-Inch 4 GB
Reviews.Author: Jan Pierce
Reviews.Content: This is too cool.  Love the parental controls and the fact that it has tons of games.  Made a 10 year old's birthday.

Reviews.Title: Give Me Phone Back!
Reviews.Author: Lex
Reviews.Content: When I first ordered the Kurio for my two boys, I didn't know what to expect. Both boys on Christmas loved their gifts and were more than excited to use them. After figuring out the parental controls and downloading some apps from the Amazon store, my boys won't put the Kurio down. Because they had to share the I-pad with their dad, now they keep calling their Kurios "my I-pad." Because of some of the features, they really can't tell the difference between the two! I like the parental controls, ability to download from the Amazon app store, touch screen features, pin ability, and avatar selection for each child. The only thing I would improve is the screen resolution. Other than that. I'm really proud of myself for purchasing a quality product for a low price.

Reviews.Title: Really Disappointed
Reviews.Author: ethaniel war
Reviews.Content: I never commented but really disappointed me, buy this device Christmas gift for my 5 year old son and was excited about what it offered this tablet for my son but sadly the reality was different, the tablet promised 4 GB of storage and really only whatever with a measly 500 MB of internal storage and a 2GB internal SD, all other functions that served well but if you have no capacity for its limited storage facility. and never mind as I return would represent an expense which can not take it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product / service
Reviews.Author: marlondixon
Reviews.Content: My daughter LOVES the Kurio Kids Tablet with Android 4.0 - 7-Inch 4 GB and I love it too because it keeps her quiet,busy and off my phone and laptop LOL !

Reviews.Title: Christmas Gift
Reviews.Author: Robert L Daddona
Reviews.Content: I have no idea? We purchased the Tablet as a Christmas gift for our Grandson. We are however, long time customers of Amazon and would not still be a customer if not completely satisfied with your great customer service!! Have a great Holiday.

Reviews.Title: kids kurio
Reviews.Author: ANN
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my great granson's birthday and he just started using it on his birthday but he was thrilled to get it. It came quickly and was well packaged.

Reviews.Title: It's a christmas gift.
Reviews.Author: happy shoppper
Reviews.Content: Haven't given it to my grandson yet.  By the way - I just wanted one, you send and billed me for two.  Martha Lydick

Reviews.Title: Kurio Kids Tablet
Reviews.Author: Janice Scott
Reviews.Content: Great but does not hold a charge long enough.Easy to travel with but difficulty downloading other games from inrternet

Reviews.Title: VERY SLOW, DIFFICULT to use!!
Reviews.Author: V. W. Echeverri "J&V;"
Reviews.Content: We got this as a Christmas present for my toddler. He loved it and I was impressed by the looks. We played a games together, the Angry Birds, World of Goo, Water game, a Few Numbers games that we BOTH played. Best of all, it comes with the rubber bumper cover and a few Free full version games. Wow, great deal right?! NO not really.First, I noticed it took 2-3 HRS to charge compared to an Apple item that takes 30 mins. NOT cool when you have a 3-year old to distract while you get chores done or if you want to sit a little longer at a cafe.Next, it was DIFFICULT to set up, and this is that I am computer-literate. The keyboard is a pain to type in, underlines everything and is overly-sensitive as it types one extra letter. Also, the space is considered a key. Make sure you don't have a space after the password, Or Uh oh!It took me about 5 hours to figure out the Amazon app downloader when i went into Android interface. I was able to get 3 apps out of 10 because the Amazon app itself took 30 mins to download, WITH the help of Chat support!After all this, i noticed the 10 apps I chose didn't all go through because the system kept kicking off the Wi-fi signal. I've never had a problem with the Wi-fi in my house with ANY device, but the tablet keeps kicking it out.I went in the next day to re-install the Free kids apps from Amazon and the downloader tool wasn't working anymore. I have them in my Amazon purchase history but the downloader has completely stopped and to re-install is AGAIN a pain in the butt.Third, the tablet turns off even before the 2 minute "no activity" rule. it just plain turns off.I am really about to return this as I might as well get a Kindle or an iPad mini. It's not worth it to spend 3 hrs figuring out an electronic when you could be playing games with your child :(

Reviews.Title: Great for my son....and for me!
Reviews.Author: P. Davis
Reviews.Content: I'm really not sure why folks are leaving so many negative reviews.... I purchased this tablet for my 2-1/2 year old son for Christmas because he really likes my Galaxy S3 and my laptop....but I wanted something a little more kid-friendly on which I can control the content.  Out of the box it worked fine as an android tablet.  I set up the parental section and profiles for mommy, daddy and for my son.  As stated, the Kurio store is limited but I had no problem installing the Mobile 1 store or the Amazon app store.  I've installed plenty of free apps (mostly puzzles and coloring and writing stuff - my boy is only 2-1/2) for my son and I've installed many apps for mom (on the Android side).  I got the 32 GB microSD card and ripped several of his favorite movies into MP4 format and they play just fine.  Speaker sound is limited but I have an inexpensive set of headphones when needed.  I've streamed TV episodes that I've missed.... I've connected to WI-FI both at home and at my work and I really don't think that this tablet deserves all the poor reviews.  Like one earlier reviewer said - read the directions.  This is not an iPad.  This tablet is designed for a child.  It works well for kids and mommy has her kindle app and her netflix and its all good...

Reviews.Title: No boring specs, just a review of how it works
Reviews.Author: Cristi Snapp
Reviews.Content: Santa brought two of these to our house, one for each child. The 1st star is simply because I can not give a no star review, but the second one is because the kids love these... so far. I, however, do not. I tried accessing the Kurio store to look for new games and books and got a big fat nada. I went to the website (where I purchased these, I did not get them on Amazon) and found a list of instructions for installing updates for the new and improved Kurio store. Nada. The updates run halfway through and then then quit. The tablet has actually not "crashed" but the updates do not install properly, regardless of what I do. I am trying to install other app stores and I get, again, nada. I have tried contacting Kurio, but so far I have been very disappointed. I am afraid that I will be stuck with 2 $150 paper weights after the kids beat all the pre-installed games. If I had it do over again, I would have went with the Kindle Fire. So, if you want expensive paper weights, go ahead and purchase this item, but if you have other goals in mind, do a little more shopping around.

Reviews.Title: In the process of returning to store!
Reviews.Author: rustedharmony
Reviews.Content: Okay I bought this 2 days ago just before the store ran out. I was excited because my daughter wants to play with our Amazon tablets and laptop. So I had a chance to set it up only to have the Amazon App store wont log me in anymore (reading error try again later) when my other tablet let me in! It also began to read errors on downloaded apps I had in the Cloud. I couldnt get into the games for 5 seconds before it said "error" and shutting it down. Yesterday it erased 5 apps out of no where so I tried to redownload them, only to find I couldnt get into my app store. Also if you want to get into the internet, you need to bookmark the pages unless you want your 4 year old to memorize (www) whole site links to access the site. And in order to get into the bookmark options your child will have to search so this is not exactly "Free Reign" by themselves playing with Parental Control. It will be you being handed the devices every 10 minute to figure out where to go! The games that are on there didnt really fit a 3-5 year old unless they know high math facts. I am just going to let my daughter play on my tablet with her own slide page of games. I wish it worked because my daughter would have loved this Parental Control device! Near the end only half of the apps work from me downloading off the Amazon Cloud from the day before. ONE BIG POINT if you stored apps on the micro sd, it will not read them! I had to search to find the 4 movies I had on my 16GB (in the file manager). So overall, dont get it. If you want to be frustrated, go ahead. I am getting my $149 plus tax back!

Reviews.Title: Dissappointed /Liked it
Reviews.Author: HstnWins2012
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Tablet for my two children for Xmas 2012. My got a chance to pick a gift to open and she picked the Tablet. For what it is worth, its a kid friendly tablet. After a couple hours playing with it and plugging it up to charge. My daughter ran downstairs and said it was really HOT! I took the tablet and had to get a towel to take off the drop holder. The tablet was extremly HOT. I contacted online chat and they will be sending me a replacement.Online tech support told me it was the first they had heard about the Tablet overheating. Anyone else have this issue?

Reviews.Title: Horrible product
Reviews.Author: K Carr
Reviews.Content: Please do yourselves a favor and stop looking at the Kurio tablet and get a Kindle Fire for your kids instead.  The Kurio is a waste of money and energy.  The battery has completely died and the device will not power on after less than 3 months of normal use.  The graphics are sub-par at best and the interface is not very user-friendly even for adults.  I am currently trying to file a claim under the company's 1 year warranty, but they require a proof of purchase, which I don't have because the tablet was a gift.  While I wait and listen to my son ask me for his "computer" every other day, I have installed the Kindle Free Time app on my Kindle Fire and my son and I have been sharing it.  He is 2 and a half and can navigate easily between apps and books on the Kindle.  Save yourself the frustration and get a tablet your whole family can enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Easy and Fun
Reviews.Author: Thumbs up
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up.  Easy to connect to WiFi.  Easy to download apps.  Love that there is a time management setting.  Easy for my 6 year old to use and 'get around" the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Kurio
Reviews.Author: Angela Burris
Reviews.Content: I bought this item for my daughter for Christmas, I did enjoy the product, however, just ONE day after Christmas, my daughter went to take the cover off of the tablet, and her thumb cracked the screen, and then it stopped working completely! She is only five, so I don't believe the strength of a 5 year olds thumb, should be able to cause that much damage! So my opinion is, it just must be poorly made. I also did not recieve a charger for it, as stated on the box as included.
